alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen and central King William Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over King William. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... King William, Saint Stephens Church, Aylett, Manquin, Biscoe, Central Garage, Rumford, Palls, Turpin, Upshaw and Walkerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Western King William; Western King and Queen
